comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The subject of an earlier (c.1900) sketch by Sir William Johnson - nla.gov.au/nla.pic-an2962632

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Thinking there must be a c.1900 photo of this view, for Johnson to draw from.  Don't remember seeing it, do you?

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] No, but Johnson took his own photos didn't he? Maybe this one never made it into a collection (or more likely has yet to be digitized). There's a similar photo by John Henry Harvey at the State Library of Victoria, but that's likely to be closer to 1910 in my opinion - www.slv.vic.gov.au/pictoria/gid/slv-pic-aab66470 - There are also some colour photos from 1912 documenting the demolition progress in The Rocks (no idea what collection they're from, they're uncredited in The Rocks by J. Coleman, but likely to be in the Mitchell Library). One shows some kids sitting on the grass embankment at the left.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Another comparison recently digitized: Pinhole photographs of The Rocks, 1918 / by Cecil Tribe [Mitchell Library: PXA 1148] - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=825556 - See: 1. A bit of old Sydney – Trinity Avenue

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] You're a fountain of knowledge and wisdom!

comment.author: 97539983@N07
comment._content: The rock formations and stairs at the end of the street have not changed. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/97539983@N07/10507772914/]
